explains: n. 钟摆，摆锤；（局势意见等的）摇摆不定，变化不定
wordGroup: compound pendulum [物]复摆；[物]物理摆（等于physical pendulum）

sentences.en: The political pendulum has swung in favour of the liberals.
sentences.cn: 政治的钟摆已经摆向了自由派。

sentences.en: The pendulum seems to be swinging the other way.
sentences.cn: 钟摆似乎摆到另一方向去了。

sentences.en: I mentioned three reason why we want to shift this pendulum.
sentences.cn: 我提过三个原因，关于为什么我们想要改变这个摇摆不定的事态。
